complexity

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • complexity.Timer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Method, java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Linear

    public abstract class Timer
extends java.lang.Thread
implements Method
    Adds a timer functionality to Method objects.
    Version:
    October 2019
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String formatTime(double time)
      Format a double representing a number of nanoseconds as a String representation of the time corresponding to that number of nanoseconds.
      void instruction()
      The instruction method must be called in implementations of method() to delay the process
      void reportTime(int size, double expectedTime, double actualTime)
      Report on the time taken by a call of method
      static void setDelay(double delay)
      Set the delay for slowing down processes The same delay factor should be used for all processes, so this method is static

      Reports the time taken by a call of this Timer's method(n), in nanoseconds.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Timer

        public Timer()

    • Method Detail

      • time

        public double time(int n)
        Reports the time taken by a call of this Timer's method(n), in nanoseconds.
        Parameters:
        n - the value ("size of the problem") to be timed.
        Returns:
        the time taken for this problem size, in nanoseconds.

      • time

        public double time(int n,
                   int runs)
        Reports the average time taken by a number of calls of this Timer's method(n), in nanoseconds.
        Parameters:
        n - the value ("size of the problem") to be timed.
        runs - the number of times this time should be measured (and averaged).
        Returns:
        the average time taken, in nanoseconds, for this problem size over the full set of runs.

      • setDelay

        public static void setDelay(double delay)
        Set the delay for slowing down processes The same delay factor should be used for all processes, so this method is static
        Parameters:
        delay - the duration, in milliseconds, of a delay action

      • instruction

        public void instruction()
        The instruction method must be called in implementations of method() to delay the process

      • formatTime

        public java.lang.String formatTime(double time)
        Format a double representing a number of nanoseconds as a String representation of the time corresponding to that number of nanoseconds. The representation will be in terms of the largest subunit of a second that is contained in that time.
        Parameters:
        time - the number of nanoseconds in the time interval
        Returns:
        a String representation of the time interval specified

      • reportTime

        public void reportTime(int size,
                       double expectedTime,
                       double actualTime)
        Report on the time taken by a call of method
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the problem
        expectedTime - the length of time (in nanoseconds) that execution was expected to take
        actualTime - the length of time (in nanoseconds) that execution actually took
